title: Dad who killed son by deliberately leaving him in hot car for gets year's jail
text:
Kristopher Taylor killed his four year-old son Riley by leaving him in a car with its window cracked when he couldn’t find childcare while he worked. He was jailed for a year (Pictures: Fox5)

A father who killed his four year-old son by deliberately leaving him in a hot car for six hours has been jailed for one year.

Kristopher Taylor, 26, was jailed for a year on Friday after admitting the second-degree manslaughter of his son Riley in St Paul, Minnesota in May.

Taylor – described as a ‘terrific father’ by sentencing judge Robert Awsumb – had struggled to find childcare for his son on the day he was working at a Grill Fest event.

So he left Riley in his SUV with a video game to keep him occupied, and cracked a window – believing it would provide sufficient ventilation to keep the youngster comfortable.

But when Taylor returned after finishing his shift six hours later, Riley was unresponsive and stiff.

Taylor said he ‘hated himself’ for what had happened to Riley (Picture: KARE11)

Taylor rushed the youngster to the nearby Regions Hospital, where Riley was pronounced dead.

He gave an emotional insight into his devastation ahead of sentencing Friday, telling the court: ‘I miss my son, I miss him a lot, and no one can hate me more than I hate myself.’

Riley’s mother Julie Juers also wrote a letter supporting Taylor, saying: ‘I know Kristopher is sorry…

‘He never intended for things to go the way they did,”.

‘Every bit of me knows this was not intentional.’

Juers asked Judge Awsumb to consider a non-custodial sentence, with Awsumb ultimately imposing a staggered prison term.

It will see Taylor spend six months in jail, with the other six spent at home while being electronically monitored.

Taylor will be allowed work release privileges during the six months he will spend in prison, KARE11 reported.

He was also ordered to continue grief counseling, and will work with probation officers to warn others of the dangers of leaving children in hot cars.
description: Kristopher Taylor left his four year-old son Riley in his SUV with its window cracked and a video game to keep the youngster occupied while he worked...but Riley still ended up dying
